newsitem.title: UK: Goldman's Davies says no word on BOE appointment.
newsitem.headline: Goldman's Davies says no word on BOE appointment.

text.p: Despite intense speculation that he will soon be appointed deputy governor of the Bank of England, Goldman Sachs chief economist Gavyn Davies said he has not been asked to fill the key monetary policy role.
"Gordon Brown said he was going to appoint two deputy governors -- he's still going to appoint two," Davies told Reuters, at Goldman's annual foreign exchange conference.
"As to whether I'll be one of them, no-one has said a word to me. I haven't the faintest idea," he said. "I am very happy where I am."
Asked whether he expected to be approached on the subject, he replied: "No, I don't expect anything."
